title: Girl accidentally shot at Idaho gun range
content:
RUPERT, Idaho -- Authorities in south-central Idaho say a 12-year-old girl required hospitalization after being accidentally shot at a gun range.
Minidoka County Sheriff Eric Snarr said the girl was shot with a 9mm handgun Sunday afternoon at the Rupert Gun Range.
Snarr says the girl was taken by helicopter to Portneuf Medical Center in Pocatello.
Snarr told KTVB Tuesday morning that the girl is now back home in Burley after being released from the hospital.
There is video of the incident which leads investigators to conclude this was an accident. The county prosecutor is still looking at the video to determine if a crime was committed.
